title.narrative: Decentralisation of anti-corruption reform is promoted through local oversight and participation.
Decentralisation of anti-corruption reform is promoted through local oversight and participation.

target.value: By 2018 - At least 100 civic activists are trained By 2018 – At least 20 local civic initiatives supported By 2018 - At least 3.000 people reached out by local campaigns

actual.value: - UNDP organized an Anti-Corruption School that built capacities of 100 civic activists on corruption prevention since its start in 2016. UNDP also launched the Online Against Corruption Campaign in 2016. which reached over 150 civic activists. - Since 2016 has provided civic activists. journalists and civil society representatives with skills and tools that are required to fight corruption. In overall the project supported 30 (15 CSOs) nationwide and 51 local civic initiatives (40 CSOs) through seed grants since its start in 2016. - National Anti-Corruption Bureau of Ukraine and UNDP launched a campaign. Students against Corruption. 4.270 students from 23 universities where reached (including DumkoFest opinion festival). The UNDP-supported celebration of the Global Dignity Day and Anti-corruption Day in Nov-Dec 2016-2018 ran discussions with elements of the anti-corruption lesson. 55.000 students in 587 schools in all regions of Ukraine participated.

target.value: By 2018 - At least 100 civic activists are trained By 2018 – At least 20 local civic initiatives supported By 2018 - At least 3.000 people reached out by local campaigns

actual.value: Progress by 2016: - 370 civic activists equipped with knowledge and skills to fight corruption via capacity building workshops and country-wide information campaigns - 18 CSOs representing 14 oblasts implement anti-corruption initiatives in their local communities - 1.250 high school students in around 50 schools around Ukraine equipped with knowledge on anti-corruption via a country-wide educational campaign

target.value: By 2018 - At least 100 civic activists are trained By 2018 – At least 20 local civic initiatives supported By 2018 - At least 3.000 people reached out by local campaigns

actual.value: The collaboration with CSOs both at the national and regional/local level has proved to be important for the strengthening of civil society in the field of combating corruption. However. through the interviews. the RT became aware of activities by the CSOs that need closer monitoring by UNDP. as these might be at odds with national legislation.

title.narrative: Assistance rendered to establishment of regulations on issues of conflict of interest, assets declarations, and corruption risk assessment, which spell out mandates and operational procedures for the duty-bearers.

Assistance rendered to establishment of regulations on issues of conflict of interest, assets declarations, and corruption risk assessment, which spell out mandates and operational procedures for the duty-bearers.

target.value: • No fewer than 10 instruments elaborated and adopted; themes - conflict of interest. assets declarations. and corruption risk assessment

Progress towards 2018 target: • 2018 - No fewer than 10 instruments elaborated and adopted; themes - conflict of interest. assets declarations. and corruption risk assessment • 2018 – Assessment of instruments as satisfactory by national and international experts – yes / no

actual.value: The Ukrainian parliament adopted a big anti-corruption package and important legal instruments in recent years. which foresees several anti-corruption bodies are established; app 15 ongoing or finalized AC initiatives; and many partners interested in contributing to AC policies. Despite many challenges. the ETI Project is instrumental supporting the e-declaration system. Support to NACP contributed to increase institutional capacity. Worth noting is the NACP Strategy. that was approved in June 2017. Collaboration with CSOs at national and regional/local level proved to be important for strengthening CSOs to combat corruption. Some activities by CSOs needs closer monitoring by UNDP. Two major factors: 1. NABU shows sincere interest to be included in the project and express support to several areas. 2. EU ACI (also supported by Danida) takes lead among the development partners in anti-corruption – including support to NACP and NABU.

target.value: Progress towards 2018 target: • 2018 - No fewer than 10 instruments elaborated and adopted; themes - conflict of interest. assets declarations. and corruption risk assessment • 2018 – Assessment of instruments as satisfactory by national and international experts – yes / no

actual.value: • New e-declaration system provided & launched for civil servants to reveal their assets and incomes. • 9 regulations on e-declaration and officials’ lifestyle monitoring developed and adopted • A tool for conflict of interest prevention and management created and adopted • Corruption level assessment piloted to be used annually to measure the level of corruption in the country

target.value: (1) Ukraine’s position in Corruption Perception Index (a scale of 0 to 100. where 0 is highly corrupt and 100 is very clean) should improve. (2) Ukraine’s position in Worldwide Governance Indicators’ Control of Corruption Indicator (Governance Score. a scale of -2.5 to +2.5. where higher values correspond to better governance) should improve.

actual.value:
(1) from 27 (2015) to 32 (2018). (2) from -0.98 (2015) to -0.78 (2018).
Indices reflect a slow but steady improvement in perceptions of Ukraine’s performance. In terms of establishing anti-corruption architecture. Ukraine has made substantial progress during the period (key A-C bodies. laws and strategies now established) to which the engagement has contributed.

The CoE/CJR Project is highly professional; among many good results the team was impressed with the results obtained at the legislative level with the Public Prosecution Service together with the high capacity developed with the Free Legal Service both at the Centre- and de-central level. The UNDP/ETI Project has throughout the implementation period been challenged by the fact that the area of anti-corruption intervention is highly politicised and specifically for this project. the main collaboration partner. NACP. has for different reasons not shown full commitment to the various capacity development efforts being provided. The UNDP/OO Project has to a very large extent succeeded and the OO has among a number of impressing results. including at the regional level. Moreover. collaboration with civil society has been instrumental in increasing the credibility of the Office.

• Ukraine’s current position in indices regarding corruption improved. CPI: from 144/177 (25 score) in 2013 to 131/176 (29 score) in 2016; WGI control of corruption: from -1.09 in 2013 to -0.98 in 2015 • Istanbul Anti-Corruption Action Plan’s 4th round monitoring progress update report noted progress in 2 provisions relevant to the project activity (asset declarations and conflict of interest regulation) • NACP established. National system for digital submission of assets declarations is in place and operational. 133.000+ declarations submitted to the system in 2016
